title: The Forged Expense Report
setting: Atlas Ventures, finance department, Thursday 3 PM
premise: A fraudulent expense report for $8,500 was submitted and approved using a forged manager signature. The report was dropped in the finance inbox sometime between 9 AM and noon on Wednesday.

suspects.name: Warren Burke
suspects.motive: Deep in personal debt and recently denied a salary advance
suspects.alibi: I was in client meetings off-site all Wednesday morning. I visited three clients in the industrial district between 8 AM and 1 PM. Each meeting lasted about an hour.

suspects.name: Gina Marchetti
suspects.motive: Handles expense approvals and knows exactly how to bypass safeguards
suspects.alibi: I was at my desk processing reports all Wednesday morning. My coworker Lisa sat next to me the entire time. We even had lunch together at noon.

suspects.name: Roger Yates
suspects.motive: Used company funds for personal travel before and was warned about it
suspects.alibi: I was in the executive boardroom from 9 AM to 11:30 AM for a strategy session with the CEO. Then I had a phone call in my office until 12:15 PM.

suspects.name: Diana Cross
suspects.motive: Responsible for printing and distributing forms, with access to blank expense templates
suspects.alibi: I was running errands for the office all morning. I went to the post office at 9 AM, then the supply store, and got back around 11:30 AM. I have receipts for both stops.

clues.title: Finance Inbox Timestamp
clues.content: The mail clerk says the finance inbox was empty when he delivered the morning mail at 9:45 AM. The forged report was found in the inbox at 11:15 AM by Gina.

clues.title: Printer Log Analysis
clues.content: The office printer log shows an expense report template was printed at 10:22 AM Wednesday from the workstation in the copy room. That workstation has no assigned user.

clues.title: Client Visit Verification
clues.content: Warren's first two client meetings are confirmed. But his third client says their meeting was rescheduled to Thursday â€” Warren was not at their office Wednesday morning.

hints.text: Consider whether each suspect's alibi truly accounts for the entire morning window.
Were all of those off-site client meetings actually confirmed for Wednesday?
